summary.topic: my talk today is about the art of short form content
summary.summary: my talk today is about the art of short form content. i'll start by exploring its importance and techniques for creating impactful messages in a concise format. stay focused and let's dive in.

summary.topic: i am a short form content creator with various characters
summary.summary: i'm a short form content creator, known for playing different characters. you might have seen me at Founders Inc yelling at people. that's it, that's me.

summary.topic: my characters include a pretentious greek character, a french character, and a tech character
summary.summary: one of my characters is a pretentious greek character, and then there's a rich french european character. it was the most embarrassing moment; everyone was staring at me, thinking i was a fool. i also have a tech character—those are the three characters i've done.

summary.topic: my videos have collectively garnered over four billion views across platforms
summary.summary: these characters have gotten over four billion views across platforms like tik tok, youtube, and instagram. we can't even track twitter, so that's not included.

summary.topic: my formula to create viral videos is quite simple
summary.summary: i follow a simple formula: create a satirical, engaging character for videos across platforms. it's ridiculously easy.

summary.topic: i create satirical, engaging characters in relatable scenarios
summary.summary: someone like plucked from a movie or a ridiculous person you've encountered, engaging and satirical. i showcase them in different scenarios, like a rich french european whose dad wouldn't give him more money for a club. i find the most interesting ones, and that's the key.

summary.topic: the key part is to film these scenarios in a realistic way
summary.summary: part i films realistic scenarios with different characters and places, and this straightforward approach has generated highly viral content. an example of this success is the european kid video.

summary.topic: one of my characters, the european kid, has gained significant followers
summary.summary: i have about 1.5 million followers on youtube and over 600k on instagram. my new focus is a tech character called my tech coo, and we're nearing 100k followers on instagram. one crazy experience was posting a video with last-minute captions, improvising that i'm the richest family in europe, and not realizing the impact it would have.

summary.topic: a video I posted went viral and led to major news coverage
summary.summary: video went viral but what happened

summary.topic: the video falsely suggested I was related to a billionaire, causing widespread speculation
summary.summary: all major news media started discussing a video claiming a person was related to the richest family in europe, worth over $200 billion. as rumors spread, reputable outlets like leon, often compared to the new york times in france, investigated and debunked the claims, exposing them as false.

summary.topic: it shows the power of a single video to create massive interest
summary.summary: one improvised video i made led to a bunch of false reports about me being the son of europe's richest family. media outlets like the daily mail and new york post picked it up, causing half of france to question if there was another billionaire heir. i'm sharing this not to impress, but to show the power of a simple video with the right concept.

summary.topic: most of my initial videos did not get many views
summary.summary: my early videos got few views, like the one you just watched. but over time, i've identified specific principles that made my content go viral. in this talk, i'll share what i've learned and these principles to help you in your content creation journey.

summary.topic: i have identified four keys to creating viral content
summary.summary: creating viral content means focusing on a strong hook. every video needs to grab attention right away. there are many factors, but the hook is key based on my experience.

summary.topic: the first key is the hook—every second counts, especially the first few
summary.summary: the first few seconds of your content are crucial for hooking new viewers and providing context. without a strong hook, they won't understand why they should keep watching. secondly, consider the emotion you're trying to evoke.

summary.topic: the second key is the emotion evoked by the video
summary.summary: the video shows a rich french european kid freaking out at his parents for not sending him $10,000, which elicits negative emotions but still gets views on tiktok. the platform promotes it because it grabs attention, regardless of whether the emotions are good or bad. moving forward, the focus will be on creating content with better emotions, but it's important to remember that any emotion can capture attention.

summary.topic: the third key is to create questions in the viewer's mind
summary.summary: you want people to ask questions while watching your content instead of feeding them everything. they should wonder what's next or sense what might happen and follow through. this leads to the final and crucial point.

summary.topic: the fourth key is to avoid giving the audience everything they want
summary.summary: giving the audience what they want means creating content that leaves them wanting more, so they re-watch it. use hooks and emotions to captivate viewers, making them curious enough to seek answers by watching repeatedly. by analyzing viral videos, you can apply these principles to keep audiences engaged and ensure your content stands out and goes viral.

summary.topic: do not make your videos too long; keep them engaging and concise
summary.summary: the video is too long and needs to be half its current length, whatever that may be. it lacks a clear focus and a strong hook; starting with a seagull isn’t effective. trim it down and get to the point.

summary.topic: contextual and engaging hooks are crucial, like starting with crying or a powerful question
summary.summary: your hook should be the interesting part you're talking about, not the seagull and the Golden Gate Bridge. starting your video with that isn't strong enough and doesn't segue well into your main content. grab your audience's attention in the first 20 seconds with engaging lines or break down your content into multiple videos. this way, viewers will remember what you said. the current approach lacks context and distracts from your main point.

summary.topic: showing unique or unusual perspectives can make your content stand out
summary.summary: the video lacks context and a clear concept, making it hard to understand or feel hooked. it should have a better title or some form of explanation to make viewers interested. however, the unique aspect of featuring chess is interesting and different from usual content. adding just a bit more clarity about what's happening would improve it significantly.

summary.topic: blending high production quality with emotional storytelling can make videos compelling
summary.summary: this video makes you feel good with its nice music and high production quality, but it's a bit hard to follow. while it's great that it elicits strong emotions and curiosity, it could benefit from slightly more context to balance keeping the audience engaged without overdoing it.

summary.topic: concept and context should be clarified early in the video
summary.summary: these videos have cool content, like a chess player winning in five moves or robots playing football, but they lack context. a simple title or brief explanation, like "it's raining, so I built a robot to play football," would help viewers quickly understand and engage with the content.

summary.topic: experiment with different formats and styles to see what works best
summary.summary: the video feels like it's trying to express being trapped and misunderstood, but the opening is slow and might lose viewers. it starts with the guy talking, then moves to another shot of him discussing the lyrics, which drags. jump to the emotional core of the song faster; maybe add context like "i made this song after my girlfriend broke up with me" to grab attention. break it up, keep it punchy.

summary.topic: gather feedback on your videos to understand viewer preferences
summary.summary: met someone while waiting for a sweatshirt at a conference, now we're a team of four in london and san francisco, working on an app called schol huma. it helps people with diabetes track their activities and understand the impact. inspired by a teammate diagnosed with type 1 diabetes at age two.

summary.topic: focus on simple, clear, and engaging storytelling
summary.summary: we're building a community of diabetics through social media to see how many people we can help in just weeks. the video felt too corporate and long, touching on too many concepts like meeting the co-founder, the startup, and missing school. each concept should be its own video to keep it focused and engaging.

summary.topic: you do not need to rely on clickbait; authentic engagement is better
summary.summary: to create more captivating and viral videos, you need to break away from what people are used to seeing while maintaining a realistic touch. The story of living a double life between home and university strikes a chord, but there's room for improvement with b-roll content, possibly featuring more relevant or animated segments. Experimentation is key to understanding what content works, and once you find an effective formula, continue to build on it while leveraging your unique talents.

summary.topic: your unique talents can help differentiate your content
summary.summary: there's something unique inside everyone that can be used to create engaging content. mr. beast found his genius by obsessing over the algorithm and creating viral ideas, but you need to find your own unique angle. copying others might bring short-term success, but genuine interest and uniqueness are key. let's brainstorm ideas for viral videos, like switching personalities on stage or giving an over-the-top apple-style presentation. creativity can make any concept go viral, even mundane classroom tasks.

summary.topic: make content that resonates personally with your target audience
summary.summary: i wanted to show you how creating engaging content can help attract attention to your product. i started by experimenting with different ideas and realized my skill in doing accents. this became the foundation of my satirical character and led to more engaging content. for your educational videos, mastering short-form content can help make your long-form videos more engaging. if your product is boring, use interesting concepts to draw people in and subtly introduce your product. build an audience first, then find creative ways to promote your product organically.

summary.topic: building a brand requires more than just attention-grabbing tactics
summary.summary: quickly engaging with a strong hook is crucial in building a brand because clickbait might work short-term, but the audience will soon avoid you if they don't get what they expect. creating content that addresses attention economy issues still needs to be engaging—nobody will watch boring or preachy videos. faceless accounts using AI-generated voices and stock footage are already gaining views and will likely become more popular as AI tools advance.

summary.topic: AI tools can enhance your content creation process significantly
summary.summary: future content creation will be enhanced by ai, not replaced. ai can help generate ideas and scripts, making content creation insanely cool and efficient. don't think ai will take over; it will amplify your creative process. experimenting with ai tools is essential for optimizing production as a content creator.

summary.topic: experiment with AI-generated content to see how it can be incorporated
summary.summary: there are tons of ways you can experiment with ai tools for content creation. for example, someone created a site to make fake videos of celebrities, despite legal issues. these ai tools can open up entire new styles of content that will only get more sophisticated.

summary.topic: use real-time feedback to refine and improve your videos continually
summary.summary: questions cool nice, thank you guys for your attention. we'll all go viral, that's what I want to hear.
